ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: All the readings of the course were very interesting, I gained insight into subaltern studies approaches, and history of Latin America resistance movements in general.
I gained a great deal of knowledge about debates about resistance and revolution/counterrevolution in Latin America. I also gained valuable experience in presenting.

This was my first history course at the graduate level, and I very much enjoyed it. I gained insights into the subject matter and also into how history is studied at the graduate level, and our debates on methodology were very valuable as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is an excellent, well structured and thought out course that provides for open discussions.

The readings were all very engaging and well-chosen. Professor Joseph's warm, welcoming attitude made even those not from the discipline feel welcome. I really loved the course and don't have much to say on how to improve it.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, this is one of the best graduate courses offered at Yale.
Yes, about as much work as Con Law, great professor, will learn a lot if you are passionate about the material.
Yes, absolutely. The readings were well-selected, Professor Joseph was always willing to discuss ideas from other fields, and the assignments are manageable and interesting.
I would strongly recommend this course.
